description.narrative: For The aim of the project is to consolidate the positioning of marine World Heritage site managers as a vital driver in ocean conservation globally. Marine World Heritage (MWH), and its 46 marine sites, cover over 1/3 of all marine protected areas. Their status as beacons of hope make that they are in a unique position to actively change the management of a significant percentage of the existing global marine protected area (MPA) coverage and can thus directly make a compelling contribution to the conservation of the oceans. Funds for this project will go toward the following outcomes:,,1. Introduce innovative new dimension to MPA Management by serving as a role model for accountability in conservation action and donor investments.,2. Provide a new, positive impulse to ocean conservation by promoting success stories and management best practices among 46 top MPAs, spread over 33 countries.,3. MWH site managers will work together as the first international MPA network to provide leadership to key ocean conversation challenges.,4. Provide a catalyst role in spreading minimum standards for best practices for management to other MPAs in their respective regions, especially in the fields of ecosystem based management and marine spatial planning.,,The work of this project will aim to consolidate the network of MWH as a leader for change in ocean conservation globally.
